title: Scientific Writing Mechanical Error Improvement Course for EFL Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A course focused on recognizing and improving mechanical errors (spelling, punctuation, capitalization, etc.) in research report writing by science professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least 80% of major mechanical errors in scientific writing during PBL project execution.
Learners can reduce their own writing errors by 50% within two weeks using peer feedback and AI proofreading tools.
Learners can explain at least ten punctuation error patterns that occur during Korean-to-English translation in scientific writing.

resources: Sample database of English scientific papers
Gender-based error recognition difference analysis worksheet

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
